Broom methods for tidy cuminc objects

Source: R/broom_methods.R
broom_methods_cuminc.Rd

Broom methods for tidy cuminc objects

# S3 method for tidycuminc
tidy(x, times = NULL, conf.int = TRUE, conf.level = 0.95, ...)

# S3 method for tidycuminc
glance(x, ...)

Arguments

x

object of class 'tidycuminc'

times

Numeric vector of times to obtain risk estimates at

conf.int

Logical indicating whether or not to include a confidence interval in the tidied output. Defaults to FALSE.

conf.level

The confidence level to use for the confidence interval if conf.int = TRUE. Must be strictly greater than 0 and less than 1. Defaults to 0.95, which corresponds to a 95 percent confidence interval.

...

not used

Value

a tibble

tidy() data frame

The returned tidy() data frame returns the following columns:

Column NameDescription
outcomeCompeting Event Outcome
timeNumeric follow-up time
estimateRisk estimate
std.errorStandard Error
n.riskNumber at risk at the specified time
n.eventNumber of events at specified time
n.censorNumber of censored observations at specified time
cumulative.eventCumulative number of events at specified time
cumulative.censorCumulative number of censored observations at specified time

Confidence intervals

The confidence intervals for cumulative incidence estimates use the recommended method in Competing Risks: A Practical Perspective by Melania Pintilie.

$$x^{exp(±z * se / (x * log(x)))},$$

where \(x\) is the cumulative incidence estimate, \(se\) is the standard error estimate, and \(z = 1.96\) is the 97.5th percentile of the standard normal distribution.

See also

Other cuminc() functions: autoplot.tidycuminc(), cuminc()

Examples

cuminc <- cuminc(Surv(ttdeath, death_cr) ~ trt, trial)

tidy(cuminc)
#> # A tibble: 228 × 12
#>     time outcome     strata estimate std.error conf.low conf.high n.risk n.event
